message.content:
↑ Skill adds Fabric-specific context — lookback window and CDC lag handling are absent from the baseline plan.
↑ Step count meaningfully higher with skill (4 vs 3) — the reconciliation model for late arrivals beyond 3 days is a production-relevant addition.
↑ Enum guard is Salesforce-aware with the skill; baseline uses generic values that will likely miss real picklist values.
↑ Source freshness check is only present in the skill plan — important for catching Fabric pipeline lag before DQ tests run.
↓ Neither plan addresses SCD Type 2 — a customer table at silver layer often needs history tracking.
↓ Test severity levels (warn vs error) absent from both plans — in production, not every DQ failure should halt a run.
